#Text=Chapter 12
#Text=The library looked as she had pictured it .

#Text=The green-shaded lamps made tranquil circles of light in the gathering dusk , a little fire flickered on the hearth , and Selden 's easy-chair , which stood near it , had been pushed aside when he rose to admit her .
#Text=He had checked his first movement of surprise , and stood silent , waiting for her to speak , while she paused a moment on the threshold , assailed by a rush of memories .
#Text=The scene was unchanged .
#Text=She recognized the row of shelves from which he had taken down his La Bruyere , and the worn arm of the chair he had leaned against while she examined the precious volume .

#Text=But then the wide September light had filled the room , making it seem a part of the outer world : now the shaded lamps and the warm hearth , detaching it from the gathering darkness of the street , gave it a sweeter touch of intimacy .

#Text=Becoming gradually aware of the surprise under Selden 's silence , Lily turned to him and said simply : " I came to tell you that I was sorry for the way we parted -- for what I said to you that day at Mrs. Hatch 's . "
#Text=The words rose to her lips spontaneously .
#Text=Even on her way up the stairs , she had not thought of preparing a pretext for her visit , but she now felt an intense longing to dispel the cloud of misunderstanding that hung between them .
#Text=Selden returned her look with a smile .
#Text=" I was sorry too that we should have parted in that way ; but I am not sure I did n't bring it on myself .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text= So that you really did n't care -- -- ? " broke from her with a flash of her old irony .

column1: #Text=" So that I was prepared for the consequences , " he corrected good-humouredly .
#Text=" But we 'll talk of all this later .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=While he spoke she had moved slowly to the middle of the room , and paused near his writing-table , where the lamp , striking upward , cast exaggerated shadows on the pallour of her delicately-hollowed face .

#Text= You look tired -- do sit down , " he repeated gently .

column1: #Text=She did not seem to hear the request .
#Text=" I wanted you to know that I left Mrs. Hatch immediately after I saw you , " she said , as though continuing her confession .
#Text=" Yes -- yes ; I know , " he assented , with a rising tinge of embarrassment .
#Text=" And that I did so because you told me to .

#Text=Before you came I had already begun to see that it would be impossible to remain with her -- for the reasons you gave me ; but I would n't admit it -- I would n't let you see that I understood what you meant .

_	_	_	_

#Text= Ah , I might have trusted you to find your own way out -- do n't overwhelm me with the sense of my officiousness ! "

column1: #Text=His light tone , in which , had her nerves been steadier , she would have recognized the mere effort to bridge over an awkward moment , jarred on her passionate desire to be understood .

#Text=In her strange state of extra-lucidity , which gave her the sense of being already at the heart of the situation , it seemed incredible that any one should think it necessary to linger in the conventional outskirts of word-play and evasion .
#Text=" It was not that -- I was not ungrateful , " she insisted .
#Text=But the power of expression failed her suddenly ; she felt a tremor in her throat , and two tears gathered and fell slowly from her eyes .
#Text=Selden moved forward and took her hand .
#Text=" You are very tired .

#Text= And now you must let me make you some tea : you know I always have that amount of hospitality at my command . "

column1: #Text=She shook her head , and two more tears ran over .
#Text=But she did not weep easily , and the long habit of self-control reasserted itself , though she was still too tremulous to speak .
#Text=" You know I can coax the water to boil in five minutes , " Selden continued , speaking as though she were a troubled child .
#Text=His words recalled the vision of that other afternoon when they had sat together over his tea-table and talked jestingly of her future .
#Text=There were moments when that day seemed more remote than any other event in her life ; and yet she could always relive it in its minutest detail .
#Text=She made a gesture of refusal .
#Text=" No : I drink too much tea .
